event: First European contact by Spanish explorers
English establish first colony in Suriname
Dutch take control of Suriname under Treaty of Breda
Society of Suriname formed to administer colony
Start of indentured labor migration from British India
Suriname becomes a constituent country within the Kingdom of the Netherlands
Suriname gains independence from the Netherlands
Sergeants' Coup led by Dési Bouterse installs military regime
December Murders: 15 opposition leaders executed by military
Return to civilian rule and adoption of new constitution
Democratic elections; Ronald Venetiaan becomes president
Dési Bouterse elected president despite past human rights abuses
Chandrikapersad Santokhi elected president, defeating Bouterse
